data.title: On real iOS device Update function stopped from being called
data.body: After I call for a first time spriteBatch.Begin(); Update function stops from being called. With no exception It just stops. And I can observe this on iPhone, on emulator everything works fine. I really can't figure out what's wrong.

data.title: Strange issue loading PNGs under Linux
data.body:
I've got a strange issue where running the same MonoGame game under Linux results in different texture loading results.  This is from loading PNG files:

![test](http://i.imgur.com/VWL1mp7.png)

![test](http://i.imgur.com/1tAFhiX.png)

![test](http://i.imgur.com/kydbLTn.png)

Could this be an issue with MonoGame, or is it more likely an issue with my graphics drivers?

data.title: Fixes bug where the WindowsPhone template will not work in Visual Studio 2013
data.body:
This change in the __Game.vstemplate will make it so that visual studio 2013 will look for any Microsoft.VisualStudio.SmartDevice.ProjectSystem.Base assembly reference.

Currently I am not able to test this behaviour on Visual Studio 2012.

An alternative would be to create a separate template for Visual Studio 2013.

data.title: Windows GL - Game Deactivate fired during startup
data.body:
In the GL version (maybe others), when the game launches, MG raises the Deactivated event during the first creation of the graphics device. This happens in ResetWindowBounds because of the following line:

```
        bool wasActive = IsActive;
        IsActive = false;
```

The IsActive property goes on to raise the game Deactivated event because the game is falsely marked as Active before initialization is completed.

Microsoft XNA does not do this. I am not sure when the game is considered "active" in the MSFT XNA world.

The full stack trace looks like this:

```
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Raise<System.EventArgs>(System.EventHandler<System.EventArgs> handler, System.EventArgs e) Line 845 + 0x11 bytes    C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.OnDeactivated(object sender, System.EventArgs args) Line 652 + 0x1c bytes   C#
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Raise<System.EventArgs>(System.EventHandler<System.EventArgs> handler, System.EventArgs e) Line 239 + 0x11 bytes    C#
```

>   MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.IsActive.set(bool value) Line 150 + 0x4c bytes  C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGamePlatform.ResetWindowBounds(bool toggleFullScreen) Line 202 + 0xa bytes C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.ResizeWindow(bool changed) Line 769 + 0x42 bytes    C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges() Line 283 + 0xf bytes    C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceManager.Initialize() Line 383 + 0x8 bytes  C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceManager.CreateDevice() Line 124 + 0x8 bytes    C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.BeforeInitialize() Line 268 + 0x9 bytes C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoInitialize() Line 739 + 0xe bytes C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Run(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameRunBehavior runBehavior) Line 466 + 0x8 bytes   C#
>     MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Run() Line 456 + 0x22 bytes C#

data.title: Monogame No Longer Renders With Xamarin Android 4.12 Beta
data.body:
I was on the beta version of Xamarin Android (details at bottom), and finally determined that a game which had worked on stable 4.10.2 had stopped functioning.  When I rolled back to stable, indeed it functioned fine.

When on the beta 4.12, even the MongoGame Android starter simple (cornflower blue) failed to render.

I included Monogame source latest projects vs dlls finally so I could trace a little.

Splash screen shows, then goes to black and hangs.

Window.Run() in AndroidGame:BeforeRun is where nothing happens.  Ultimately derived from an OpenTK base class of AndroidGameView.

Then the BeforeRun will always return false, which then returns you immediately out of the Game:Run().

I notice that the OpenTK 0.9.9.3 ships alongside a new 1.0.0.0?


data.title: [WP8] Calling SoundEffectInstance.Stop(true) unstable state.
data.body:
By calling SoundEffectInstance.Stop(true), any subsequent calls to
SoundEffectInstance.Play(...) have no effect.

By calling Calling SoundEffectInstance.Stop(true) the object gets into
an unstable state.

The buffer is not cleared, which causes the .State to always return
.Playing , which in turn causes .Play() to always return early without
starting the _voice.

The behavior of .Stop(true) should be similar to .Stop().

data.title: Added MGCB To Windows Installer
data.body: Edited the installer script to include MGCB in the Windows installer.

data.title: ReloadGraphicsAssets - ReloadAsset being removed on linkage.
data.body:
I've noticed that there are a few Issues here on GitHub (reported as fixed) that states problem when compiling on Release.
I've also noticed that these problems are related to Linking process. It only happens when the user assemblies (including MonoGame) are linked.
The error occurs here (ContentManager class):

```
var methodInfo = typeof(ContentManager).GetMethod("ReloadAsset", BindingFlags.NonPublic | BindingFlags.Instance);
```

The GetMethod method returns null, because it can't find the method "ReloadAsset".
I found this issue on Android, but maybe it happens on other platforms.

I'm not sure why this method is being called using reflection thou, and not directly. I think it's to allow custom ContentManagers, but anyway...
It would be great if we hint the compiler to avoid linking this method.
I did came up with a solution, but I would like to hear somebody else's opinion on this issue, before submitting the PR.

This is the solution I've came up with:

```
                if(asset.Key == null)
                    ReloadAsset(asset.Key, Convert.ChangeType(asset.Value, asset.Value.GetType()));
```

Inside ReloadGraphicsAssets method, inside the foreach loop.
This code never gets called, but the compiler is hinted to NOT remove the ReloadAsset method.

data.title: Version 3.1.2.0 and Windows Phone 8 Project
data.body:
I took the installer for version 3.1.2.0. I created a MonoGame Project for Windows Phone 8.
 I run it and recognized that the Draw(GameTime gameTime) function was never called (screen on emulator does not display time). This worked with previous versions.

data.title: Version 3.1.2 and Win Phone
data.body:
I took the installer for version 3.1.2.0. I created a MonoGame Project for Windows Phone 8.
I run it and recognized that the Draw(GameTime gameTime) function was never called (screen on emulator does not display time). This worked with previous versions.

data.title: Fixed Intermediate Output Paths
data.body:
This adds the `<IntermediateOutputPath>` property to each project configuration so that intermediate files are completely separate for each configuration and platform.

I suspect this is what is causing https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2227.

data.title: Creating new project in VS 2013
data.body:
When attempting to create new windows store or windows store (XAML) projects I get the following error.  It doesn't seem to matter where I have it set to save or if I have the check box for adding to source control clicked or not. 

Error: this template attempted to load component assembly 'Microsoft.VisualStudio.WinRT.TemplateWizards, Version=11.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a' 

I updated to Version=12.0.0.0 but that gets a little further but then causes issues with creation of the actual projects so I end up with an empty solution.

data.title: MonoGame 3.2 installer installs Windows (DX) framework assembly into WindowsGL
data.body:
Install MonoGame 3.2, then inspect Assemblies/WindowsGL/MonoGame.Framework.dll in ildasm.  The assembly manifest is referencing SharpDX instead of OpenTK.  The assembly is a copy of Assemblies/Windows/MonoGame.Framework.dll.

This is the underlying issue behind #2114.

jaquadro/MonoGame-WinFormsControls#2 is another example of someone being tripped up by this.

I don't see any immediate issues with the nsi or csproj files, but the build process is rather opaque to me.

data.title: [Linux] Slow NPOT rendertarget performance
MGFX File is corrupt
data.body:
I'm running into an issue with effects after trying to move my XNA project over to MonoGame. I know about the content processor, so I have my set up as follows:
- VS 2012 MG Project with all my code and a content folder.
- Separate VS 2010 Express MonoGame content project just for building effects. Here, I'm moving my effects over to be compiled using the MG Effect Content Processor. It seems to work fine and outputs XNBs correctly. Except when I copy those XNBs into my content folder in my game project, I always get the "MGFX file is corrupt" error. And yet I don't know why.

I've looked into a few fixes but nothing seems to resolve it. For the record, I'm compiling my xnbs like this:
![effect](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4923199/2128297/545a9b6a-9279-11e3-8eb4-3247eddb4b73.PNG)

I only have three effects so there's really no reason to have them built in my game project, and it seems VS2012 has an issue with that anyway. Any suggestions?

Thanks.

data.title: Fix for Texture2D constructor for PSM not setting GraphicsDevice
data.body: Fix for Texture2D constructor for PSM not setting GraphicsDevice or checking for null.

data.title: Resolves issues with loading 'Content' for PSM and OSX.
data.body:
This brings the behavior into alignment with XNA so that 'Content' is located
consistently relative to the ContentManager.RootDirectory.

data.title: Fixes numerous issues in PSM
data.body:
Some Details

78fcd7c - Allowing MP3 files to load under PSM

35ac85e, 24fbbe7 - Reverting a recent change that broke font and vector functions under PSM that were previously working in cross platform code in XNA, PSM, Xbox360, iOS, OSX and Android.

4f8fb2b - There was a missing assignment to GraphicsDevice in private Texture2D(GraphicsDevice graphicsDevice, Stream stream) for PSM that was causing a null reference exception reported here. http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/492456

4e624e6, b3e3f22 - Please check this carefully...  I think is this be because I started working on a branch of develop that was very old.

data.title: Resolves issue with content loading in develop
data.body:
Makes loading of content behave the same across all platforms. 
As long as content is placed in 'Content' folder then default paths for resources loading 
seems to work in all environments.

data.title: Fixed DrawingSurfaceBackgroundGrid in Game.xaml
data.body: credit to nZeus/MonoGame, fixes issue with functions not being called in WP8 builds.

data.title: Black Screen in WP8 project
data.body:
When I build my project to my Device or emulator I get the system tray and a black screen (no cornflower blue). I've tried changed DrawingSurface to DrawingSurfaceBackgroundGrid in GamePage.xaml, but then I get this:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2206002/2115987/d5506460-9063-11e3-8237-2a4f83b20ddc.png)

and this in my output:
A first chance exception of type 'System.NullReferenceException' occurred in MonoGame.Framework.DLL
An exception of type 'System.NullReferenceException' occurred in MonoGame.Framework.DLL but was not handled in user code

Any solutions? I've tried multiple new projects.

data.title: GetUniformLocation is really slow
Game freezes after first Draw call
data.body:
Having a weird issue running the standard MonoGame 3.0.1 template on my device.
While the default template may look like it runs, if you debug to the console (or or modify it to make the sprite spin) it will only do the first draw call in Game1.cs.
This is only when testing on my device (iPhone5, iOS 7.0.4), testing on simulator will work fine.

So far I have narrowed it down to Tick within iOSGamePlatform.cs only gets called once.  If I comment out Game.Tick(); then Tick will get called multiple times.

data.title: Fix loading of transparent PNGs
data.body: A fix for the issue discussed here: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1946

data.title: Content Pipeline Fixes
data.body:
This is a bunch of content pipeline fixes developed during the process of getting model support functional.  
- MGCB now supports relative assembly paths.
- MGCB now dumps the inner exception when it fails.
- `IndirectPositionCollection` wasn't doing the "indirect" part of its work.
- Added the `MeshHelper` class with stubs for unimplemented members.
- Added our implementation of `MeshHelper.CalculateTangentFrames`.
- Added `MeshHelper.FindSkeleton`.
- Added `MeshHelper.SwapWindingOrder`.
- Fixed `VertexContent.VertexCount` to return the correct count.
- Fixed `VertexBufferContent` to write any vertex format.
- Added support for `ArrayWriter` to `ContentCompiler`.
- Fixed `ArrayWriter.GetRuntimeReader` to properly encode to element type.

Note while i have some changes to `FbxImporter` in here that work will be discarded.  @JamesLupiani has a complete replacement FbxImporter that we have been testing and will push up soon.

data.title: Game.Draw called after Windows.Close throwing a GL invalid operation exception
data.body:
When exiting an Android app, Game.Draw is still successfully called after AndroidGameWindow.Close.

This results in a GL Invalid Operation exception.

I have not checked if this applies to other platforms.

Test device: Nexus 7 (Android 4.4.2).

data.title: Include OpenTK.dll.config as copy-on-build for Linux
data.body: For some reason, the OpenTK.dll.config file is not specified as part of the MonoGame Linux project.  When this file is not copied to the output directory, it can not load OpenAL correctly.

data.title: Network gamer id is always 255?
data.body:
Tried to play with network in monogame 3.0.1 but it seems that player Id is always 255 making it difficult to distinct network players :( 

Property: NetworkGamer::Id

data.title: Reduce frame latency for WP8
data.body: This brings to WP8 the same behavior we have for other Win8/DX targets.
